data.title: Finding Aid for the Poster Collection, ca. 1890-
data.text:
The sun spends the winter on the French Riviera. France : by and for the French Government, [between 1930 and 1960] (Paris : Bedos & Cie. Imprimerie).

Physical Description: 1 print : color ; 99 x 65 cm.

Scope and Content Note

Signed in upper left: "Dubois" (possibly Dubuis). At bottom: "Ministère des Travaux Publics des Transports et du Tourisme _ Commissariat Général au Tourisme."

All the charm and atmosphere of France pervades the ships of the French Line Compagnie Général Transatlantique / Veritable "bits of France afloat" / New York - Plymouth - Havre. U.S.A. : [s.n.], 1939.

Physical Description: 1 print : color ; 66 x 49 cm.

Scope and Content Note

At bottom: "F268-A Jan. 1939."

Trilby. A novel by George Du Maurier, with one hundred and twenty illustrations by the author. [New York] Harper & Brothers, ca. 1894.

Physical Description: 1 item. 48 × 32 cm. Poster.

Scope and Content Note

Advertisement for the book.

General note

Special Collections has a catalogued copy of the New York edition.

Comité d'assistance en Alsace-Lorraine / Tombola Artistique / Tableaux, objets d'art, autographes / Plus de 200 lots offerts par les artistes, hommes de lettres, musiciens, contemporain / 9500 billets; un lot garanti à chaque groupe de 50 billets / Prix de billet: 5 Francs / Exposition du 7 au 30 Avril 1916 au Musée des Arts Decoratifs Pavillon de Marsan, 107, Rue de Rivoli / Prix d'entrée de l'Exposition: 0f 50c. Nancy : Lithographie Berger-Levrault, 1916.

Physical Description: 1 print : color ; 115 x 80 cm.

Scope and Content Note

Stamp in lower right: "BILLETS au Siège Social 23, Rue d'Artois, 23". Stamp in text below word Alsace-Lorraine: "23 RUE ARTOIS"

"The Child at Your Door" / 400,000 orphans starving no state aid available / Campaign for $30,000,000 / American Committee relief in the Near East Armenia - Greece - Syria - Persia / 1 Madison Ave. New York ~ Cleveland H. Dodge Treas. New York : American Committee relief in the Near East, [1917] (New York : American Lithographic Co.).

Physical Description: 1 print : 2 color (black and gray) ; 52 x 35 cm.

Scope and Content Note

Unidentified artist's monogram under girl's right elbow: "HP"(?). DPP logo (Committee on Public Information, Division of Pictorial Publicity) at lower right of image. Date from LC record.

"The time has come to conquer or submit." -- "For us there is but one choice. We have made it" -President Wilson / Buy a Bond of the 2nd Liberty Loan and help win the war / A Liberty Bond is a United States Government Bond. New York : American Lithographic Co., [1917].

Physical Description: 1 print: color ; 76 x 51 cm.

Scope and Content Note

In bottom left: "No. 8"

Answer the Red Cross Christmas Roll Call / All you need is a heart and a dollar. [Washington, D.C.?] : Committee on Public Information Division of Pictorial Publicity, [1918] (Chicago : Edwards & Deutsch Litho. Co.).

Physical Description: 1 print : color ; 70 x 50 cm.

Scope and Content Note

Signed in lower right: "Ray Greenleaf." Dimensions approximated.

Civilians when we go through this we need all the help and comfort you can give / The Jewish Welfare Board / United War Work Campaign -- Week of November 11 -- 1918. New York : Alco-Gravure, Inc., 1918.

Physical Description: 1 print : 2 color (brown and blue) ; 84 x 56 cm.

Scope and Content Note

Signed in bottom of image: "Signey H. Riesenberg." Star of David under upper title.

Don't fail to visit the Conservation Shop 724 Eighteenth Street Phone Champa 5798 / All work is done there by women and for women whose incomes have been impaired by the war / Handmade laces.... / Headquarters of the Home Relief Committee of the Women's Council for Defence of Colorado and for Denver. [Denver, Colo.? : Home Relief Committee of the Women's Council for Defence of Colorado and for Denver?, 191-].

Physical Description: 1 print : 1 color (black) ; 36 x 29 cm.

Scope and Content Note

For the safety of womanhood, for the protection of childhood, for the honor of manhood, and for liberty throughout the world, help 'till it hurts. Washington, D.C. : Liberty Loan Committee, [1918]

Physical Description: 1 print : color ; 51 x 33 cm.

Scope and Content Note

Signed in bottom of image: "DARFOUR-KER(?)" Image caption: "From the Delineator, April, 1918 issue."

Hunger / For three years America has fought starvation in Belgium / Will you eat less wheat meat fats and sugars that we may still send food in ship loads? [Washington, D.C.?] : United States Food Administration, [191-].

Physical Description: 1 print : 2 color (red and black) ; 74 x 54 cm.

Scope and Content Note

At lower left: "No.12." USFA emblem at bottom.

June 28th the dawn of a new era in American history! The era of complete self-denial and united effort to win the war. Every day, every hour consecrated to working and saving for this great purpose. [Washington, D.C.?] : USFA, [1918] (Denver, Co. : Brock-Haffner Press)

Physical Description: 1 print : color ; 53 x 36 cm.

Scope and Content Note

Signed at bottom-center: "Cocks-Clark." Decorative border with USFA emblem also at bottom-center. Cocks-Clark: W.A. Cocks and H.M. Clark. Through their collaboration, they gained entry into Denver's printing industry as Cocks-Clark Engraving in 1906 and became distinguished as the largest supplier of copper and brass engraved plates in the region. Company is now: Cocks-Clark Graphics, Inc. (from cocks-clark website: www.cocksclark.com).

Keep it coming / "We must not only feed our soldiers at the front but the millions of women and children behind our lines" Gen. John J. Pershing / Waste nothing. [Washington, D.C.?] : United States Food Administration, [191-] (New York : W.F. Powers Litho. Co.).

Physical Description: 1 print : color ; 70 x 50 cm.

Scope and Content Note

Signed in top left: "ILLIAN." At lower left: "No.14." USFA emblem at lower left. Dimensions approximated.

Lest they perish / Campaign for $30,000,000 / American Committee for relief in the Near East Armenia - Greece - Syria - Persia / One Madison Ave., New York Cleveland H. Dodge, Treasurer. New York : American Committee for relief in the Near East, [1917] (New York : Conwell Graphic Companies).

Physical Description: 1 print : color ; 46 x 31 cm.

Scope and Content Note

Signed in lower left of image: "W. B. King" (artist/designer name from LC record). Date from LC record.

Life in the Navy / Food for fighters / Sea fighters must have A-1 stuff and the American Navy is the best fed in the world. Before taken on board ship, every ounce of meat is inspected ... Come in for fighting and big eats and enlist in the Navy. New York : Press of U.S. Navy Recruiting Bureau, [191-].

Physical Description: 1 print : b&w photomontage ; 35 x 43 cm.

Scope and Content Note

On left and right sides under photos: "U.S.N.". Two Navy logos under center photos. Lower center photo reads: "Daily Navy Ration".

Little Americans Do your bit Eat Oatmeal - Corn meal mush - Hominy - other corn cereals - and Rice with milk. Save the wheat for our soldiers. Leave nothing on your plate. [Washington, D.C.?] : United States Food Administration, [1917].

Physical Description: 1 print : color ; 53 x 36 cm.

Scope and Content Note

Signed in lower right of illustration roundel at top. USFA logo at bottom center. "No. 21" at lower left corner. Date from LC record.

Make our American Red Cross in peace as in war / "The Greatest Mother in the World" / Third Red Cross Roll Call Nov. 2-11, 1919. [Wahington, D.C.? : American Red Cross?], 1919.

Physical Description: 1 print : color ; 76 x 49.5 cm.

Scope and Content Note

Illustration after Alonzo Earl Foringer (see variant poster).

Mr. Hoover requests: Consume stuff nearest to point of production. This avoids transportation congestion and will help win the war! / U.S. Exposition -- Denver April 5th to 12th 1918! Denver, Colo. : Union Printing and Publishing Co., 1918.

Physical Description: 1 print : 2 color (red and black) ; 53 x 70 cm.

Scope and Content Note

U.S. emblem reads: "Buy goods made in Colorado." The top corners patched with contemporaneous U.S. Exposition stamps.

Navy! Uncle Sam is calling you / Enlist in the Navy! / Recruiting Station / "I want you in the Navy and I want you now." New York : Leslie Judge Co., 1917 (Los Angeles, Ca. : Western Litho. Co).

Physical Description: 1 print : color ; 74 x 53 cm.

Scope and Content Note

Illustration after James Montgomery Flagg. In lower right: "Reprinted by request from Leslie's Preparedness number July 6, 1916."

Navy! Uncle Sam is calling you! Enlist in the Navy! Do it now! I want you. New York : Leslie-Judge Co., 1917.

Physical Description: 1 print : color ; 36 x 27 cm.

Scope and Content Note

Bottom right: "Reprinted by Request from Leslie's Preparedness Number July 6, 1916.

Order your coal now / Get it out of Uncle Sam's way -- he needs the railroads for the war. [Washington, D.C.?] : United States Fuel Administration, [191-] (New York : United States Prtg. & Lith. Co.).

Physical Description: 1 print : 2 color (orange and black) ; 70 x 53 cm.

Scope and Content Note

At bottom left and right: U.S. Fuel Admin. Save that Shovelful emblems. At bottom center: "fgc."

Our flags Beat Germany / Support every flag that opposes Prussianism / Eat less of the food fighters need / Deny yourself something / Waste nothing. [Washington, D.C.?] : United States Food Administration, [1918] (Chicago : Edwards & Deutsch Litho. Co.).

Physical Description: 1 print : color ; 54 x 36 cm.

Scope and Content Note

Signed in lower right: "Adolph Treidler". USFA logo under text. In lower left corner: "OB." (A horizontal version of this poster was also produced.) Date from LC record.

See him through / Help us to help the boys / National Catholic War Council Knights of Columbus / United War Work Campaign -- Week of November 11 -- 1918. [S.l.] : National Catholic War Council, 1918 (New York : American Lithographic Co.).

Physical Description: 1 print : color ; 76 x 51 cm.

Scope and Content Note

Signed in lower right of image: "BURTON RICE." National Catholic War Council emblem at lower left. Date from LC.

Sugar means ships / The consumption of sugar sweetened drinks must be reduced / For your beverages 400 million lbs. of sugar were imported in ships last year. Every ship is needed to carry soldiers and supplies now. [Washington, D.C.?] : United States Food Administration, [1917] (New York : The Carey Printing Company).

Physical Description: 1 print : 1 color (black) ; 39 x 48 cm.

Scope and Content Note

Signed in lower left of image: "E. Fuhr." USFA emblem in top left. Printer's device at bottom left (wings with wheel reading: "the seal of quality"). DPP symbol (Committee on Public Information, Division of Pictorial Publicity) at left of image. Date from LC record.

The deadly question / "What am I doing to help win the war?" / Work Serve Save / And you? Washington, D.C. : National War Savings Committee Advertising Service Division, [191- ].

Physical Description: 1 print : 1 color (black) ; 63 x 41 cm.

Scope and Content Note

The girlhood of America is her second line of defence / YWCA will tell you what America expects of her girls / A call to the colors. [S.l.] : Y.W.C.A., [191-].

Physical Description: 1 print : color ; 75 x 51 cm.

Scope and Content Note

All text except for the "YWCA" in its upside down triangle logo. 4 areas of text: 3 horizontal in a vertical stack and 1 vertical down the left side.

The Queen of Belgium appealed to the Red Cross to aid in saving the children / The children are the hope and future of Belgium. [S.l.] : War Council of the American Red Cross, [191-].

Physical Description: 1 print : 2 color (black and red) ; 53 x 35 cm.

Scope and Content Note

Artist's signature at bottom left of image: "A.T.F." Under the text: "Bulletin No.8 -- issued by the War Council of the American Red Cross to show the people of America how their generous contributions are being expended in the interest of humanity." At bottom center: "Post in a conspicuous place -- A.S. Burleson, Post-Master General."

The Red Cross supplies 30,000 people each week with information concerning relatives in the fighting forces at home and overseas ... [S.l.] : War Council of the American Red Cross, [191-].

Physical Description: 1 print : 2 color (black and red) ; 53 x 36 cm.

Scope and Content Note

Text only with Red Cross emblem underneath. At lower right: "Bulletin No. 10 -- issued by the War Council of the American Red Cross to show the people of America how their generous contributions are being expended in the interest of humanity." At bottom center: "Post in a conspicuous place -- A.S. Burleson, Postmaster General"

War rages in France / We must feed them / They cannot fight and raise food at the same time / Denying ourselves only a little means life to them. [Washington, D.C.?] : United States Food Administration, [191-].

Physical Description: 1 print : 2 color (gray and black) ; 76 x 51 cm.

Scope and Content Note

At lower left: "No.19." USFA emblem at bottom.

Where the victims are / Save the survivors -- 3,950,000 starving people / Campaign for $30,000,000. New York : American Committee for Relief in the Near East, [1917?].

Physical Description: 1 print : color ; 54 x 71 cm.

Scope and Content Note

At bottom: "1 Madison Ave. New York City; Cleveland H. Dodge, Treasurer." Area, population, and death statistics to left of map.

Workers lend your strength to the red triangle / help the "Y" help the fighters fight / United War Work Campaign -- November 11 to 18. [S.l.] : Y.M.C.A., [1918].

Physical Description: 1 print : color ; 68 x 50 cm.

Scope and Content Note

Signed in lower right of image: "Gil [artist's mark] Spear."

His home over there / More than 2000 such homes for our boys / United War Work Campaign, November 11th-18th. [S.l.] : Y.M.C.A., [191-] ([Washington, D.C.?] : Committee on Public Information Division of Pictorial Publicity).

Physical Description: 1 print : color ; 105 x 71 cm.

Scope and Content Note

Signed in bottom right: "ALBERT HERTER." Red YMCA and blue YWCA emblems flanking the top text. At bottom left, under image: "4104." Publisher's emblem at lower right of image.

If you can't go across with a gun come across with your part of the Red Cross War Fund. [S.l.] : Red Cross, [1917] (New York : The United States Printing and Lithograph Co.).

Physical Description: 1 print : color ; 103 x 70 cm.

Scope and Content Note

Signed in lower left of image where text begins: "C.W. LOVE." Printed on newsprint? Date from LC record.

20,000 tons of clothing desperately needed by Germany's victims in Belgium and Northern France / Germany will not clothe them America must ... Newark, NJ : Commission for Relief in Belgium, [191-] (New York, New York : Allied Printing Union Label)

Physical Description: 1 print : 2 color (red and blue) ; 96 x 64 cm.

Scope and Content Note

Four years in the fight / The women of France / We owe them the houses of cheer / United War Work Campaign. [S.l.] : Y.W.C.A., [1918] (Cincinatti ; New York : Strobridge Litho. Co.)

Physical Description: 1 print : color ; 107 x 71 cm.

Scope and Content Note

Signed: "L. Jonas." Dimensions from LC record. Date from other posters for the same campaign.

A Wonderful opportunity for you / United States Navy offers to American citizens of good character ... the best chance to see the world, save money and serve their country [text blocks] [New York? : New-Art Lithographic Company Inc.?, 1917?] New York, N.Y. : New-Art Lithographic Company Inc., [1917]

Physical Description: 1 print : color ; 96 x 53 cm.

Scope and Content Note

Signed in lower right of image: "RUTTAN." Monogram just above: "RKC 2"(inside a triangle). Image caption: "GOING HOME-ON LEAVE." Publisher, printer, and date from LC record of slight variant.

The Navy put 'em across / The Service for Travel and Training Ages 17 to 35 / Apply Navy Recruiting Station. [S.l.] : Press U.S. Navy Recruiting Bureau, 1918.

Physical Description: 1 print : color ; 117 x 74 cm.

Scope and Content Note

Signed in lower right of image: "H. Reuterdahl US.N '18." Stamps reading: "Keep your W.S.S. Pledge" used on verso to repair some of the tears.

On the job for victory / United States Shipping Board Emergency Fleet Corporation. Philadelphia, P.A. : Publications Section Emergency Fleet Corporation, [191-]. ([Washington, D.C.] : Department of Pictorial Publicity)

Physical Description: 1 print : color ; 76 x 98 cm.

Scope and Content Note

Signed in lower left of image: "JONAS LIE."

The Navy needs you! Don't read American History -- make it! New York : The H.C. Miner Litho. Co., [191-].

Physical Description: 1 print : color ; 107 x 71 cm.

Scope and Content Note

Signed in lower right of image: "JAMES MONTGOMERY FLAGG."

U.S. Navy / Help your country / Enlist in the Navy / Navy Recruiting Station / 117 West Ocean St., Long Beach. Brooklyn, N.Y. : Latham Litho & Ptg. Co., [191-].

Physical Description: 1 print : color ; 104 x 71 cm.

Scope and Content Note

Signed in lower right of image: "H. Reuterdahl." At lower left under image: "Courtesy of R.J. Collier, Esq."

For every fighter a woman worker / Y.W.C.A. / Back our second line of defense / United War Work Campaign. New York : The United States [Printing &] Lith Co., [191-].

Physical Description: 1 print : color ; 105 x 69 cm.

Scope and Content Note

Signed in upper right of image: "ERNEST / HAMLIN / BAKER."

Over [T]here! / Skilled Workers / On the ground [behind the lines] in the Air Service ... [S.l. : United States Air Service?, 191-].

Physical Description: 1 print : color ; 84 x 72 cm (trimmed).

Scope and Content Note

Signed in lower right of image: "LOUIS~ / FANCHER." In lower left of image: "PRO~ / PATRIA." Poster trim and in-painting seem to be attempt to make poster only applicable to homefront work.

"In the strength of great hope we must shoulder our common load" / Buy Victory Bonds. [Washington, D.C.] : U.S. Treasury Department, 1945 ([Washington, D.C.] : U.S. Government Printing Office).

Physical Description: 1 print : color ; 66 x 47 cm.

Scope and Content Note

Signed in lower right of image: "c.c. beall." At lower right: Victory Loan emblem. At bottom: "1945--O-662911 / An Official US Treasury Poster / WFD 32." Issued as a memorial to FDR after his passing.

"No loyal citizen to the United States should be denied the democratic right to exercise the responsibilities of his citizenship, regardless of his ancestry ..." The President of the United States, February 3, 1943. Washington, D.C. : Office of War Information, 1943 (Washington, D.C. : U.S. Government Printing Office).

Physical Description: 1 print : 2 color (black and red) ; 51 x 21 cm.

Scope and Content Note

At lower left: "OWI Poster No.75." At lower right: "1943--O-533582."

"One swine too many..." / The Nazis in Holland tried to spread the idea that slaughtering unweaned calves would leave more milk for dutch children. They devised the slogan - "One calf too many means no milk for eight children." Dutchmen, however, altered the slogan to read - "One swine too many means starvation for many people." [Netherlands? : s.n., 1945?].

Physical Description: 1 print : color ; 75 x 51 cm.

Scope and Content Note

Dutch poster printed for display in Allied English-speaking countries. (Publication information from Midden-Holland Regional Archives).

"This world cannot exist half slave and half free" / Fight for freedom! Washington, D.C. : Graphics Division Office of Facts and Figures, 1942 (Washington, D.C. : U.S. Government Printing Office)

Physical Description: 1 print : 2 color (black and brown) ; 51 x 36 cm.

Scope and Content Note

Signed in lower left of image: "JOHN FALTER." At bottom: "1942-O."

Allies for a big job / OCD / Cooperate with your local Defense Council. [Washingont, D.C.? : Office of Civilian Defense?], 1942 ([Washington, D.C.] : U.S. Government Printing Office).

Physical Description: 1 print : color ; 50 x 54 cm.

Scope and Content Note

Signed in lower right: "EMILY NEWMAN." At lower right: "1942--O-473121."

Can all you can / It's a real war job. Washington, D.C. : Office of War Information, 1943 (Washington, D.C. : U.S. Government Printing Office).

Physical Description: 1 print : color ; 57 x 41 cm.

Scope and Content Note

At lower left: "OWI Poster No.77." At lower right: "1943--O-533993."

Conserve rubber for National Defense ... Proper care of tires conserves rubber, saves gas too! [S.l.] : Schrader in the interest of National Defense, [194-].

Physical Description: 1 print : 2 color (red and blue) ; 34 x 52 cm.

Scope and Content Note

At lower right: "1085 Litho'd in USA." Uncle Sam: "I need all the rubber you can save."

Enlist in a proud profession! Join the U.S. Cadet Nurse Corps / A lifetime education - free! If you can qualify. [Washington, D.C.] : U.S. Public Health Service Federal Security Agency, [194-].

Physical Description: 1 print : color ; 71 x 51 cm.

Scope and Content Note

Signed in bottom of image: "Edmundson." At bottom: "For information go to you local hospital or write U.S. Cadet Nurse Corps, Box 88, New York, N.Y."

Give it your best! Washington, D.C. : Office of War Information, 1942 (Washington, D.C. : U.S. Government Printing Office).

Physical Description: 1 print : color ; 51 x 72 cm.

Scope and Content Note

Unsigned (Artist information from Bird and Rubenstein). At lower right: "Poster No. 9 / 1942--O-488228."

I'm counting on you! Don't discuss: troop movements ship sailings war equipment. Washington, D.C. : Office of War Information, 1943 ([Washington, D.C.] : U.S. Government Printing Office).

Physical Description: 1 print : color ; 71 x 51 cm.

Scope and Content Note

Signed in lower left of image: "L Helguera." At bottom: "OWI Poster No.78 / 1943--O-534057."

Ours...to fight for / Freedom from fear. Washington, D.C. : Office of War Information, 1943 (Washington, D.C. : U.S. Government Printing Office).

Physical Description: 1 print : color ; 71 x 51 cm.

Scope and Content Note

Signed in lower left of image: "NORMAN ROCKWELL." Image caption: "Painting from the Saturday Evening Post." At bottom: "OWI Poster No.46 / 1943--O-511887." One of four images interpreting the four freedoms enumerated in FDR's Jan. 1941 congressional address and outlined in the Atlantic Charter issued by FDR and Churchill in Aug. 1941. Artist used his Vermont neighbors as models (Bird and Rubenstein, 37).

Ours...to fight for / Freedom from want. Washington, D.C. : Office of War Information, 1943 (Washington, D.C. : U.S. Government Printing Office).

Physical Description: 1 print : color ; 71 x 51 cm.

Scope and Content Note

Signed in lower left of image: "Norman Rockwell." Image caption: "Painting from the Saturday Evening Post." At bottom: "OWI Poster No.45 / 1943--O-511886." One of four images interpreting the four freedoms enumerated in FDR's Jan. 1941 congressional address and outlined in the Atlantic Charter issued by FDR and Churchill in Aug. 1941. Artist used his Vermont neighbors as models (Bird and Rubenstein, 37).

Save freedom of speech / Buy War Bonds. Washington, D.C. : Office of War Information, 1943 (Washington, D.C. : U.S. Government Printing Office).

Physical Description: 1 print : color ; 71 x 51 cm.

Scope and Content Note

Signed in upper right of image: "NORMAN ROCKWELL." Image caption: "Painting from the Saturday Evening Post." At bottom: "OWI Poster No.44 / 1943--O-510257." One of four images interpreting the four freedoms enumerated in FDR's Jan. 1941 congressional address and outlined in the Atlantic Charter issued by FDR and Churchill in Aug. 1941. Artist used his Vermont neighbors as models (Bird and Rubenstein, 37).

Save freedom of worship / Buy War Bonds. Washington, D.C. : Office of War Information, 1943 (Washington, D.C. : U.S. Government Printing Office).

Physical Description: 1 print : color ; 71 x 51 cm.

Scope and Content Note

Signed in lower left of image: "NORMAN ROCKWELL." Text in image: "Each according to the dictates of his own conscience." Image caption: " Painting from the Saturday Evening Post." At bottom: "OWI Poster No.43." One of four images interpreting the four freedoms enumerated in FDR's Jan. 1941 congressional address and outlined in the Atlantic Charter issued by FDR and Churchill in Aug. 1941. Artist used his Vermont neighbors as models (Bird and Rubenstein, 37).

Their sacrifices have saved our soil and our sons! Now let us help them...Give once for all. [S.l.] : United Nations War Relief; U.S. State Department Los Angeles area war chest, 1943 ([Union printer's mark]).

Physical Description: 1 print : black on front, red and blue on verso ; 46 x 61 cm.

Scope and Content Note

Fundraising brochure that folds out into poster. Verso (front and back covers when poster is folded) has more imagery, information, and instructions about the fund. Signed under drawing: "SHOEMAKER." Poster image caption: "Courtesy of Chicago Daily News."

United / The United Nations fight for freedom. Washington, D.C. : Office of War Information, 1943 ([Washington, D.C.] : U.S. Government Printing Office).

Physical Description: 1 print : color ; 71 x 51 cm.

Scope and Content Note

At lower left of image: "LESLIE RAGAN." At bottom: "OWI Poster No.79 / 1943--O-534058."
